node.title: Creating customized messages on your homenode
node.doctext:
Some folks have [custom] messages on their [homenode] (see [rancid_pickle|mine] for an example). Several people have wondered how to do this, so I decided to pass this information along. The original [perl] [script] comes from one of the [Everything FAQ|E2 FAQs] I was updating, so forward your thanks to folks like [Nate], [N-Wing], [JayBonci], [Professor Pi] and the members of the [edev] group.

The message on my homenode looks like this:

Rancid_Pickle is extremely impressed with the writeups by [% linkNode($USER,0,{lastnode_id=>0}); %]!

Rancid_Pickle is extremely impressed with the writeups by <strong>[% linkNode($USER,0,{lastnode_id=>0}); %]</strong>!

The perl code is between the <strong> [HTML] tags. Try to be reasonable with this little [gimmick], avoid stupid things like I caught (username) having sex with a donkey! Sometimes it's nice to see your [name] on someones homenode, and for 90% of the users, my homenode message is [accurate].

Note that this works only for members of the [gods] group.
